Reviews.Title: “Overall I would recommend this place......”
Reviews.Author: taylor12auckland
Reviews.Content: excellent location right opposite the bondi junction westfield; right beside the train and bus station etc. Rooms were clean; and quite sizeable I thought. I rented a 1 bedroom apartment. The only thing to mention is that if you want some sun, you need to get a harbourview room. Mine was not harbourview and it was very dark. Also, there is obviously a new building goin up out the back which as construction progresses will probably cause quite abit of noise. Otherwise, really clean and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service great location great value for money”
Reviews.Author: acadaSydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while our apartment was being renovated. We had a great room and couldn't speak more highly of our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative out of the city”
Reviews.Author: TenRingShanghai
Reviews.Content: The Meriton Bondi Junction is not the Ritz, but that's not why you stay there. I you're looking for a comfortable bed and a new building with decent apartments, then consider this property. I recently stayed and had the best nights sleep in a long while.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North Tumbulgum, New South Wales, Australia
Reviews.Title: “Maybe it was extra for the dirty tissues?”
Reviews.Author: Chantal W
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed here for work reasons. The first night after a very LONG day at work, came back to Hotel to fall into bed to find not just one but TWO dirty tissues and a un made bed!!!!! Disgusting! Then to my absolute delight the phone call down to reception first met with a comment of "House Keeping has gone home?" After waiting 40 minutes somebody decided to come and put clean sheets on my bed. Also the air conditioning turns itself off after 4 hours, so you wake in the middle of the night sweltering. Came home very tired and disgruntled and I will NEVER stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really great apartments close to trains”
Reviews.Author: megpowis
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here in a very comfortable apartment. It's really handy for Bondi junction and the train station is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay apart from the building works.”
Reviews.Author: belindacoles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a months trip to Australia. Knowing Sydney quite well this place appealed to me for the location to Westfields and transport links and it didn't fail on that aspect. Westfields is literally next door and Bondi Junction train station is below the building. Our one bedroom apartment was very spacious with full cooking facilities as well as a washer, dryer and dishwasher. Minimal amenities were included (cleaning cloth, washing up liquid, dishwasher powder). The apartment was also very clean and a good supply of towels and amenities in the bathroom. Along with other reviews I would agree the "serviced" part of the title is a bit of a joke as you only get service on the 8th night. But this wasn't a huge problem for us really. There was one massive downfall to the property and that was the huge construction site down below, I understand that they aren't responsible for outside works but a bit of pre warning or warning at check in would of been nice. We were woken every morning at about 6am with loud drilling. I would consider staying here again if the price was right, it served its purpose for our last 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities - good base for a Sydney stopover”
Reviews.Author: dashworth27
Reviews.Content: We were holidaying with a family group and management located us in adjacent apartments - tick! We'd opted for the more costly Harbour view floors and the outlook didn't disappoint - great vistas of the Bridge, Opera House, CBD and the Harbour. The apartment had everything we needed and its location was terrific, with easy access to the train and Westfield just across the street. Staff are friendly and helpful. The lifts struggle to cope with passenger volume during peak times but with a little patience you eventually get there. Although the property has a "no party" policy it was clear when we arrived that our other neighbours had one in full swing (Saturday night = Party night). We let it go until sleep became impossible then called Security who responded promptly and shut it down on the spot. Overall, this property was a real winner and we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the 'serviced' promises!”
Reviews.Author: polanalyst
Reviews.Content: Nothing physically wrong with these serviced apartments. Although a little tired, the size and comfort of my two-bedroomed flat was more than adequate for two couples and small toddler. Kitchen was excellent and utility room worked well. Beds were comfortable and the position on top of the Bondi Junction bus and rail station and adjacent to the lovely Bondi Junction shopping mall was just ideal for my visit of almost two weeks. However, don't be fooled by the title 'serviced apartments' as there was little service to speak of! Apparently, my very good room rate did not qualify me for any more than once-a week service and this was really disappointing. Other complaints were a very poor air conditioning system that was programmed to only remain on for four hours at a time - clearly aimed as a cost-cutting exercise. This meant that if you went to bed at 11pm, you would wake feeling hot and sticky by 4am after the system had shut down and would be forced to get up, go to the lounge, and restart the system for another four hours. This smacks of penny pinching and is no advert for this property. There were other problems over the tough New Year weekend when the hotel is fully booked. Lifts were erratic and often out of order making it a long & crowded ordeal to simply get out of the building and there were times when the very expensive parking ($20 per night) was not available. Parking was also very cramped so beware if you have a car and you don't enjoy maneuvering in tight spaces! There is Internet access but at rip-off prices so get yourself a Vodafone broadband deal for one-third of what the hotel charges! This is the type of property that seems to enjoy such a good location that some attention to detail in management seems to be overlooked as it is constantly full with guests. It is though a perfectly adequate apartment complex with access to all of Sydney literally at your doorstep but it really needs refreshed management & a little less penny-pinching. It should be renamed the "Meriton partially-serviced apartments'!

Reviews.Title: “Functional apartment”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller5
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bedroom apartment for 4 days and were happy. The apartment was spacious and functional and had everything we needed. It was not luxurious but I did not expect it to be. Also it is not in the CBD which we realised so you need to catch a train into the centre which only takes 10 minutes. There is the big Westfield across he road so there is plenty of shopping nearby. If you want to walk out your hotel into the thick of everything this is not the place for you, but if you want good value for money then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Penthouse spoiled by neighbors”
Reviews.Author: macOceanGrove
Reviews.Content: We booked the harbour view Penthouse (2001) for a surprise birthday for my wife. I had arranged for our family to meet us here for special weekend. The Penthouse apartment is sensational. Really large, well appointed with a fabulous view through the floor to high ceiling windows. Lots of balcony space too. Everything was going wonderfully until the neighbors booked in for a hens night celebration. Two shopping trolleys of booze followed. When we returned from dinner the noise and fighting including banging on our door grsdually got worse. As the strictly no partying policy was clearly displayed to be seen and it was now 1.30am we called security and after two visits some of the chaos subsided. Whilst this is disappointing it didn't spoil our stay. But when a different set of neighbors booked in the following night playing loud music , banginging doors and yelling we had had enough! When you book apartments of this quality and pay the prices charged knowing that there is a no party policy should be enough to ensure a trouble free stay. Unfortunately this was not the case. Even though security arrived promptly and did their job effectively you should not have to put up with such behavior. Nice property, bad neighbours or bad luck?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastdiner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we had to come to sydney for my daughters filming on a tv show. We found it to be brilliant, clean and very close to shops and transport and great views. We had a fully equipped kitchen and laundry and it felt like home more than a holiday apartment. We will definatley be back if we are ever in Sydney again ! Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: Moinoniin
Reviews.Content: Great location and 'harbour facing' rooms on the higher floors (was on the 16th) certainly give you great views of the harbour, city, bridge and opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: nayanayanaya
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 bedroom apt. (2 bathroom and 1 powder room) The location of the apt is great. Opposite the Westfield mall and very close to train and bus station. All are under 5 minutes walk. The size for 3 bedroom apt is good. Bedroom are ok. Living room is pretty large (combine with dining-room), kitchen also has sufficient size. Bathroom size is also pretty large but when we stayed there, the water pressure was different in master and guest bathroom. The water pressure in guest bathroom shower was fairly weak. The housekeeper puts everything inside dishwasher, and sometimes still a bit dirty when finished. (and some pans were not washed.) I'm not sure whether this service is common or not in Australia (but it didn't bother me as much). Good carpark size which located inside the building. It was a bit confusing how to get into the building by car (especially waiting on automatic car park door to open for the first time) but once you got it, it's pretty easy. Unfortunately the internet is not free. Nonetheless, we had pretty good stay in this service apt. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent extended stay for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: Iris R
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 2 months here as we worked in the Redfern and Martin Place areas. Logistics are amazing with trains and buses departing right next door. The Westfield mall is across the street: can be pricey, but your classic supermarkets are also conveniently located there. Bondi beach is 10' away by bus and 30' on foot. Centennial Park and pretty Queens St. are some 12-15' away on foot. We asked for a quiet 1-bedroom flat high up in the 20 storey building. At no extra charge we got a great 18 floor with ocean view. At 1,000$ per week it didn't come cheap, but given the space (50 sqm?), brilliant kitchen, 'conservatory', and weekly cleaning it was't bad by Sydney standards. Staff helpful and competent. Generally a highly recommendable accommodation to experience a charming side of Sudney while being 15' away from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: leetonozzie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 days in a one bedroom apartment on the 4th floor. It was clean and quiet, except when people were waiting for the lift, which was located just outside our apartment and the accoustics were terrible. However, there was demolition going on just outside the hotel and we didn't hear anything once the glass door was closed. The view on the 4th floor was not at all attractive - just tin shop rooftops. The good points were the cleanliness and the lovely youung man who cleaned our room and who washed our dishes by hand as soon as we finished eating (we were in for lunch!) even though it was not service day. The bed was quite comfortable (2 king singles together) and the bedroom was small but well equipped. The bathroom was a good size with a large bath and shower and adequate shelving. The kitchen had a Smeg stovetop and oven and large fridge and plenty of kitchen utensils. - which we used as we were there to see family. The laundry was equipped with new clean good qualitly appliances.It was very quiet at night, On the negatives: The shower had no lighting; all the door handles were protruding and gave both of us bruises as we moved around; the iron was a pathetic dry iron which made it hard to uncrease shirts; the dishwasher didn't work at all and the a/c didn't seem to work at all. Beyond the room: there were great facilities for recreation: barbecue area, v large swimming pool, sauna, gym, etc. The railway station is just below and there are buses and taxis right there as well. Across the road is a huge glitzy mall - with a hidden eatery at the very back near the cinema complex that has amazing harbour views, great food, clever interior design and you can get some of the cheapest food in Sydney! Don't miss it! All in all we had a comfortable stay and would recommend it to others, especially families.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: Kaytee33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 weeks in Sep./Oct 2011 and booked 3 months in advance for a 1 bedroom Harbour view. The central could not confirm the availability of a HV but put in a request. They then advise there were no 1 BR with HV but this was a lie as our friends stayed in one and we visited them. Apart from this glitch I have to say the location is excellent with bus & train under the building and Westfield over the road with every shop you could wish for. 10 mins to the City by train which runs every 8 mins or so. $20 per day to park on top of the room rate $200 - $350 per day is a bit steep. Not enough cutlery or crockery and room only serviced weekly. A fair bit of wear and tear evident in the room we had.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Town”
Reviews.Author: AlanGelder
Reviews.Content: Quite palatial with the view from the 18th floor something to enjoy. The harbor, ocean & city unfold as you scan the horizon. Just hope for a sunny stay. The apartment was spacious & well laid out, with 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms & a comfortable lounge/dining area. The verandah is divided into 3 sections, the central section being enclosed - which breaks up the outdoor entertaining. Also the 2 outside areas have no furnishings. Downstairs are a range of activities, with indoor & outdoor pools, spa, sauna, gym & 2 tennis courts.. Parking is also secure,though a charge of an extra $20/night/vehicle applies. Westfield Mall & Bondi Shopping Centre are virtually next door, with Railway & Bus Terminals beneath the building. Overall, a very enjoyable sojourn.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, home away from home. Great views.”
Reviews.Author: sandgroper1
Reviews.Content: We were a big family group and had two apartments on the same floor. Staff were extremely courteous and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Can say nothing but good about it”
Reviews.Author: DublinBubbles
Reviews.Content: Our family consister of 5 adults and one child and we stayed her for three nights. We had an apartment on Floor 17 and the views were magnificent. The apartment was spotlessly clean and well equiped. The staff were excellent, very friendly and efficient and only too willing to help. I thought when booking the Meriton initially that it was a bit expensive for self catering but it was well worth it for the service. Its in a great location with the train and bus station adjacent to it and we were just around the corner from central Bondi. We had a great experience staying here, all positive stuff.

Reviews.Title: “A great apartment option in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: OzBoy74
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bdm harbour view apartment in early July 2011. The unit was modern, spacious + nicely furnished. We were on the 20th floor so had very good views of the city skyline + harbour bridge. The balcony off the lounge room + the main bedroom were enclosed resulting in good sound proofing from the busy highway below. The location is fantastic - above the main bus/rail station to the city + Bondi Beach as well as across the road from Westfield Bondi Junction - awesome shopping centre! The cost was a little expensive but cheaper than the other Meritons in the city which are only 10 mins via train away from the basement so I think Bondi Junction Meriton is much better value than all of them. I will definitely stay here again next time Im in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for family getaway”
Reviews.Author: 255057Happytraveller
Reviews.Content: This is so convenient. Right above public transport. Across the road from shopping and cinema. Clean, comfortable and convenient, Kids love the pool and everything is close to hand.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: phoebe_ferens
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights before I left Sydney. It's a handy location, in the heart of Bondi Junction. Surprisingly, you don't get alot of noise from the street below which is a main thoroughfare for buses. I stayed in a one bedroom apartment, great size, huge bath! I understand it's a serviced apartment, but was a little taken aback when their book said I'd be charged $100 if I didn't take my rubbish out to the shute before I checked out. They have a tennis court, gym etc but I didn't get a chance to check them out. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The best place to view the new years fireworks”
Reviews.Author: ifam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over new years in a 1br unit overlooking the harbor. The unit was extremely comfortable and well equipped. The kitchen had everything that we could need and the beds were comfortable. The balcony was enclosed so it was safe enough for my two four year old boys to spend time on. The fold out couch was comfortable enough for our teenage girls to sleep on as well. We used the pool many times which is indoors and just the right temperature. We were only on the 7th floor but it still had a great view of the harbor and the fireworks. We decided to go into the city to view the family fireworks, which in hindsight would have been better from the hotel (there was nowhere you could go in the city to see the fireworks by the time we got there). But, we stayed in the unit for the midnight fireworks and what a view. We could see every pontoon of fireworks going off and most of the bridge. The TV was nice and close to the balcony so we could see the coverage on TV when the smoke was too thick (which the TV had issues with as well). The location is awesome as well. It is directly above the train station so the city is only minutes away. The local area has many shops and cafes in easy walking distance and you can go for a quick trip to Bondi Beach from the bus under the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Meriton Penthouse”
Reviews.Author: ms_Dewijakarta
Reviews.Content: We came to stay here because we have an appointment to see a professor in Sydney prince of wales private hospital for a medical condition . The penthouse is very spacious with beautiful view , huge balcony and most important, CLEAN ROOMS! The staff was curtous which was a plus! The mall just right across the street with the bus and train station next door! The only thing lacking was probably a porter to help us with the lugage . but beyond that everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: M3d1
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a brilliant property at a very good location, just off the Bondi Junction train station. very accessible from the airport too! No complaints about the accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed & felt cheated”
Reviews.Author: Brad W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on a purely leisure visit & was dissapointed from the moment we arrived. Reception is a lift ride away from the street where you then use another set of lifts to access the rooms - meaning every time you leave the hotel you need to use two sets of lifts. The weather was atrocious during our stay which is obviously not the hotels fault BUT the heavy rain meant you could hear rainwater running through the pipes throughout all the walls.The noise was so loud that at several times throughout the night we both got up to check that we hadnt left a window open & that water was coming in the room. The mirror in the bathroom was peeling & was covered in black mould. The 2 seat couch in the living room was extremely hard & uncomfortable Several times we needed to wait for another lift due to them being already full from people coming down from higher levels. Despite paying for parking there were times when no spots were available. My work colleagues had arranged for internet access for us without my knowledge as well as a late check out (these are normally at a charge to the guest) however as it was intended as a surprise I was not aware & no mention was made by the hotel so we did not make use of this. Overall the property was adequate but not good value for money.This is not a place we will be going back to. Being involved with corporate travel in my employment I will also be advising corporate travellers not to stay here & to not include it on any preferred hotel listing.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like a kitchen like this”
Reviews.Author: avanner
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Meriton because of the locality. We were travelling from the country by rail and it was very easy to transfer to a Bondi Junction suburban train from the Central Railway Station. We also wanted to "shop till we dropped" at the terrific shops nearby as well as being able to catch a bus into the city from the bus and train terminal beneath the Meriton. We were so impressed, not only by the super friendly reception staff but also by the quality of fittings in the 1 bedroom apartment. The fabulous full kitchen was fitted out with high quality appliances, but the coffee was TERRIBLE. Take your own for the plunger or buy it from the upmarket David Jones Food Hall across the road. The twin beds were very comfortable, but the air con was a bit chilly, so I was pleased to have access to extra blankets. We had a view over the Junction (cheaper than the Harbour view) and it was fascinating sitting on the shaded, large balcony, watching the passing parade from 3 floors up. Big TV in living/dining room and a very spacious deluxe bathroom. Wish I'd remembered to take my swimming costume to try out the great pool. Next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments in a fabulous, central location”
Reviews.Author: LucyCrabtree
Reviews.Content: After a month travelling around Australia, having an apartment rather than staying in a hotel or hostel was brilliant. There is everything you need, including much needed washing machine / dryer, and lots of space. The location is great - very close to the big parks (great outdoor cinema), and next door to both bus and underground for access to all of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellingcanuck70
Reviews.Content: great location in the heart of bondi junction shopping area - westfield mall just pretty much across the street and lots of street shops restaurants around bus / train station right beside the hotel parking lot across the street - though always full bus down to bondi beach in 15 minutes and train it out to the CBD 15-20 minutes as well rooms are nice and clean; though i didn't like the ambience because they use flourescent tubes / lighting throughout the rooms which makes it look cheap (in my opinion) but overall great place to stay and would recommend for something around the prices they have!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else- Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: KiwiKatie
Reviews.Content: Best choice of accommodation in sydney, especially as we were travelling with a small baby. Staff were professional friendly and helpful. 2 bedroom apartment with view to city was lovely, well equped. Swimming pool and spa lovely. Excellent location. Would definitely stay again and look at their apartments in queensland. Parking secure and safe,

Reviews.Title: “Good location - big apartment, great view”
Reviews.Author: AussieHolidays
Reviews.Content: The family stayed in a 3 bed room apartment. The extra money spent to get a view of the Harbour was money well spent. Suprisingly big apartment with large living area. Good location to transport hub and shopping. With windows that open in the kitchen no built up kitchen smells permeating the apartment. Only gripe is the 3 hour timer on the air conditioning - same as all Meritons, waking middle of a hot night to turn it back on again disrupts a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: HappiestTraveller
Reviews.Content: Work travel is risky, but this place was better than expected. Admittedly I was there very briefly, arriving late and leaving early. The rooms were spacious, and comfortable. The bathroom was well stocked and clean. The only real let down was an average greeting by the staff on my arrival and the lack of mini-bar (which I possibly would've known about if I'd done my research, so the blame is on me - however I do consider it a plus when away from home). The most pleasant surprise was a great harbour view when I opened my blinds the next morning. Not a bad way to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “Mean Spirited Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: EljayAdelaide
Reviews.Content: The airconditioning does not work because: 1. They have limited it to 20 degrees minimum so you can't cool the apartment down (39 degrees here today in Sydney). However, there is NO aircon coming out no matter what the thermostat says. The air is the same temp as the rest of the room ie HOT. 2. It just does not work in the main bedroom and 3. It automatically shuts down after 4 hours so if you go to bed at 10.30pm you have to set your alarm for 2.30am and then again at 6.30am to get up and turn it on again! This is simply penny pinching and mean spirited and for that attitude they don't deserve to have high-end customers paying $2,300 for three nights for 6 people in a 3 bedroom apartment! To be faair, the apartments are spectacular and the guests who stay there can afford to pay an extra ten or twenty bucks a night so they can have a cool place to sleep! The master bedroom is at the end of the "chain" or so it seems as the aircon coming out of the vent there is pathetic - AND you have to wake up twice during the night to turn it back on again! It wouldn't be so bad if you could adjust the temperature but the management has obviously decided to take that "luxury" away from the (high) paying guests. And this is just a small but nevertheless annoying thing - the web site says "view of the Opera House". You guessed it - no Opera House to be seen. The sense of being "ripped off" is enormous. If you can't see the Opera House, why on earth say that you can? And of course no-one tells you about the mean-spirited fitting of a 4 hour "timer" on the aircon. I have never come accross this before - EVER! I would AVOID this place if you like air conditioning and hate getting up twice during the night to keep turning it back on. By the way - there are also big black chunks of mould in the shower and the balcony smells of VOMIT. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short or long stay. Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CatzFan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Tiffany on quite a few occasions over the past 5 years or so, sometimes for extended business stays and most recently for a long weekend. Itâ€™s not really a hotel but a serviced apartment which we like because you have a full size kitchen, washing machine etc. We had a 2 BR apartment and each bedroom had a small balcony. The beds in each room were King size singles pushed together to make a king size bed which was very comfortable. As 2 of our group were mature non-related ladies it was a simple matter of pushing the beds apart to form 2 singles in the second bedroom. Our request for single bedding was filled within 10 minutes. The only thing we didnâ€™t really like was the airconditioning which was a bit too loud during the night. The apartment was spacious and well furnished. If you are lucky enough to get an apartment overlooking the harbour, the views from higher up are spectacular. The location of the Tiffany is just fantastic, being right above the Bondi Junction train and bus station and no you never hear or feel any train or bus traffic. This means it is very easy to get into the city or catch a bus to Bondi beach. Just across the street is a huge Westfield shopping centre which carries all the big labels and my 30 yo daughter spent quite a few hours in there. There are also supermarkets, coffee shops, restaurants and movie theatres in there too. A couple of pubs are within easy walking distance, so the area is very well catered in that respect. In summary great location and good facilities

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for Exploring Sydney with Families”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: This place really worked out great for us. Location is perfect if you want to be in the Bondi area. We used Westfield shopping mall a lot and the bus/train station with the taxi rank to get around. The rooms were great and the kitchen fully stocked with utensils, the gym was fine, views from our 2 bedroom harbor-view room were fantastic and great for the new year's fireworks. staff service was very responsive and the air conditioning worked fine. Only real negative is that they could probably use an extra elevator and expect to wait if you are on an upper floor; can take a while getting in and out of this building especially since you have to go through the lobby above ground before you get out of the building at street level. We also found the water pressure of the showers too light and wish they wouldn't skimp on that especially since we were in nearby buildings with much better water pressure. Other than that, it is a great place to stay at a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. Could be better with a lil' flexibility.”
Reviews.Author: SadatHassan
Reviews.Content: I can understand why the rooms here are flying off the racks. The staff are great, or at least the ones that I have encountered. The facilities are good. And the room, fully equipped. The apartment is just 2 minutes away from the bus and train station which can connect you to the city. And Bondi Beach, is just a 10 minutes drive down. Driving to the City is another 15 minutes away and if you look closer to the maps, it connects you to Newtown and Mackerville which is another 20-30 minutes drive. The intial plan was to stay here from 20th Nov 2010 - 25th Nov 2010, setting it as our base for our trips up to Manly, Newtown, Katoomba and Hunter Valley. However, there were some last minute changes and we had to check out on 23rd Nov 2010. For that, we were requested to pay an additional day room surcharge for early check out, which was not mentioned during check-in.We got a AUD 100 waiver from the actual price after speaking to the Manager which is good, but this is the first time I have experienced having to pay an additional day surcharge. Carpark is also chargeable at AUD 20 per night. Having said that, to be fair to the hotel management, the staff were friendly, the rooms sufficiently maintained with 2 sets of TV with cable in both the living room and bedroom. Shopping centres,supermarkets and other amenities are conveniently located in the vicinity. Stay here again? Yes. Definitely. Recommend friends here: NO. i wanna keep this place to myself :)

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: Wayne G
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally clean, helpful staff, house keeping spot on. Facilities are very good (gym, pool, suana). Only 2 kilometers from Bondi Beach. Train station within 30 meters. Being self contained helps with tight finances. Will definately stay here on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Igetaround64
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the meriton apartments many times and we are never disappointed. The apartments are so spacious, modern & comfortable lounge & furnishings. The kitchens are well stocked with everything you need. Great views to the city & harbour - spectacular at night. Across the road to some of the best shopping in Sydney and great transport right underneath your feet. You don'"t need to get the car out. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - central location, well-appointed apartments”
Reviews.Author: jodi06
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for four nights with my son to catch up with relatives who were staying in the same apartments. We has a one bedroom apartment on the eighth floor. The room is spacious and well appointed, full kitchen and washing machine and dryer in the room. Separate lounge area and two balconies, the bedroom was large enough to accommodate luggage on the floor and still walk around. The location is very central, walk across the road to Westfield shopping centre and within walking distance to restaurants, caves etc. The building is right on top of the train/bus station for transit to the city or other areas in the eastern suburbs. Parking was an extra $20.00 per night and we didn't move the car from the time we arrived until when we left. For a family I think this place offers good value for money. Also has a great indoor pool which the kids loved.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say about this stay”
Reviews.Author: SushieG
Reviews.Content: I were with the family (5 of us all up) sow e got the penthouse apartment with 3 bedrooms. It was a great deal that was literally half the price of the exact same room in the Meriton apartments in the city centre. Everything was clean, modern, user friendly. Really spacious living/dining, great kitchen with modern facilities, comfortable bedroms, lots of light and a couple of balconies. Great location, 3 mins to Bondi Junction shopping centre and if you can find them, some ncie boutique-y stores. Pool area could have been better designed and managed, but its not a real complaint, just an imperfection. Staff were friendly despite being busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Kas55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 11 nights at the Meriton in early February, and we were extremely happy with our accomodation there. We had a one bedroomed apartment on the 17th floor. It was spotlessly clean and had all we needed to be comfortable. We especially appreciated the washer and dryer. The bed was comfortable and the linens in good condition. The bathroom was spacious with a decent sized glass - doored shower. Security is good and you need a card to get to your own floor. It was very hot in February in Sydney, and it would have been good not to have the aircon turned off during the night, as it made for waking up stuck to the linen. In our time there, we only had housekeeping come in once, but it would have been nice to have had clean towels after a few days( however, I am sure if we had asked, they would have brought them for us, ditto toilet paper). As women wash their hair, a few extra handtowels would be appreciated. Our bedroom did not have a TV set in it, which was fine for us, but we did see a corner apartment with one in it, plus one in the living area. Next time, I will request a corner unit, which also seemed to have upgraded furnishings. The location of the Meriton cannot be beaten - right next door to the fabulous Westfields Mall, where you can find anything your heart desires, not to mention outstanding coffee and restaurants, and it's right on top of the train and bus services to the city and surrounding area. One gripe which does need to be addressed - we hired a car, paid $20 a night to park it, and over the weekends especially, we would come back to find not a single space available. This is because of the many buck parties etc the hotel hosts. This is all well and good, but guests should be guaranteed a parking, or given a number of a space no one else can use. It is not much fun circling around in the wee hours and then having to park your car on a ramp. All in all, we had a great stay and would not hesitate to go back when next in Sydney, but next time it won't be in the humid, hot season!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: C0aster
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment on 5th floor, had read other reviews on Trip Advisor and was a little worried about quality, but decided the proximity to bus and train transport was worth a punt. We found the apartment to be clean and spacious, with all the usual amenities. Had read the comments about air con system being noisey and cutting out, and yes the fan in our unit was a bit rattley but at 27deg and 95% humidity we didn't turn it off much. Units are double glazed so traffic noise is not an issue. Sydney is a city, if you want peace and quiet come to the West Coast of the South Island (NZ) The complex is right on top of the train and bus station, so transport to the city and harbours is a breeze. There is also a major shopping mall right next door for those wet days. Lifts were a little slow and at busy times you had to wait a bit, but they were upgrading the entrance and looked to be installing a second lift.(Entrance was a little hard to find at the time) If you are looking for a good base while in Sydney at a resonable price, Meriton Apartments is worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for location, size of rooms, luxury feel. Staff need a slap though!”
Reviews.Author: Dipshamps
Reviews.Content: Stayed at two meritons while in sydney, at Bondi it was a 3 bed with views of SOH/SHB and very happy with it. Worked out cheap for 3 of us, but luxury apartment and loads of room. Had to book a 1 bed for the last night and it was toppy, but thats the thing with sharing, its much more cost efficient. Had 2 balconys (one enclosed) and views from one of the harbour. Great to get to - above (literally) the bus station and Bondi juction trains. 10 mins cab to bondi beach. Massive shopping centre opposite with some fine dining and posh shops one end and woolies and cheaper brands the other. Shocking access to the lobby though - 1 lift for about 300 guests, sign says 'being redeveloped, wont take long' but it turns out its been 3 years like that and no plans to improve it. Barmy situation really. Then when you do get to the lobby.reception, the staff are sooooo underwhelmed to see you its a bit depressing. Think teenagers being asked to tidy their room and you are somewhere near the (albeit attractive) 20-something who served me. I nearly apologised for ruining her day. I did try to engage a couple of times with small talk like 'wheres the gym' or 'are there any rooms available for Friday night' but got a grunt and a point for the former and a 'you need to check the website, we dont do that here' for the latter. Cheers love, you have a nice day now. (but if you hate your job that much, may i suggest trying something else?) Didn;t say that, but should have done. So, go, its great for location, rooms size - genuinely impressive in the 3 bed - 1 en suite, laundry room, big kitchen, huge sofa bed! You could get 4 couples in the room we were in, woudl cost NOTHING! and dining table enough for 8. Just dont expect a smile or service cos they dont need to do any of that nonsense at Meriton - you are already there right? You must already be impressed? So we're going to sit here on Facebook and get annoyed when you interrupt our chat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: Eva2121
Reviews.Content: The service was good. Reception was friendly and efficent. We were upgraded from a one bedroom to a two bedroom which was a nice surprise. The room was clean and cosy. The view was FANTASTIC. We could see the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Harbour as well as the beach. The security was great we felt very safe here. Shops were fantastic and just across the road. My only gripe is there was a bit of traffic noise and alot of noise coming from the rooms around us. My suggestion is to stay here and bring ear plugs. The view is worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staying in apartments saves money, but appalling customer service is on offer here”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller20
Reviews.Content: I will start by pointing out, for those overseas visitors who do not know, that the Meriton Serviced Apartments are owned by one of Australia's largest property and apartment developers. Meriton is primarily a property developer and not a specialised hospitality operator. This accounts for the property's appalling customer service from checkin to checkout. These people do not have a clue about customer service. Let's start with the positives about the apartments. The apartments are located in Bondi Junction which is a fantastic location adjacent to one of Sydney's largest and most modern shopping centres, Westfield Bondi Junction, and the apartments are right on top of Bondi Junction train station offering easy access to the Sydney CBD by train in approximately 12 minutes. Also there are regular buses to Bondi Beach. There are two large supermarkets located within the mall, Coles and Woolworths so you can easily purchase food for your apartment; the Westfield also contains some lovely restaurants, around the area where the cinemas are, offering great dining options for whatever your price range. The apartments are modern but definitely not 5 star luxury - I would rate the appearance of the rooms as being 4 star but just barely 4 star - barely making it. Finishes in these apartments are on the cheap side but still modern. Most rooms have old fashioned televisions. The fridges are modern around 7 years old and some are very loud. The apartments are furnished in a modern way and there is a fully equipped laundry and a dishwasher, stove and microwave etc, a cheap white kettle in the kitchen and there are dinner plates and cutlery etc so there is everything you need to cater for yourself. This saves a lot of money and avoids the usual $40 breakfasts you end up having to pay for in hotels. Tip - bring some hangers with you as you are not given enough in the bedroom - the bedroom has large mirrored closets. The complex also has a couple of tennis courts and a swimming pool. Parking is available - at an extra charge of course - $20 bucks a day I think. The internet is available in the rooms - corded not wireless. Charge is $18 a day or $5 an hour, your choice. The Meriton Serviced Apartments are all about saving money at the expense of their guests so toilet paper is bottom of the range as are the tissues provided. Even the dishwashing tablets they provide are the cheapest available on the market. As you enter the elevator to check in you encounter a nasty note pinned up inside the elevator which provides you with your first sign of the lack of Meriton service. The sign informs you of the draconian fees for checking out more than half an hour after the set check out time which I think was 10am. I think the fine was $50 for every hour [or part thereof] that you are late. Enter the room and you encounter more of their "rules". The apartment handbook points out, as others have noted, that there is a $100 "cleaning fee" if you leave the apartment messy. This is totally not on and causes great stress when checking out as on top of packing to avoid a large financial penalty for late check out, you have to worry about cleaning your apartment and even putting out your garbage!!!! [this is specifically pointed out as an 'offence']. This is truly appalling. It should not be the responsibility of guests to clean their room on departure - what kind of hospitality establishment is this? Also housekeeping should be providing spotlessly clean plates and glasses etc for every guest not relying on the cleanliness standards of other guests quickly cleaning dishes in a hurry on their last day before they catch their flights! The handbook also informs you curtly of the "No Noise" policy. That you can be thrown out immediately with no refund if you disturb other guests with e.g. parties or loud tv noise. Now I happen to agree with this as there are many families in the apartments. I don't object to the policy just the way it is worded. We are also informed that only "registered overnight guests" are permitted. So those hoping to get lucky in Sydney had better think again! The Meriton front desk staff have absolutely no interest in guests at all, they do not smile as you pass or enquire as to your day. On the contrary you get an irritated stare. It is clear that front desk staff have had no or minimal training in customer service. As for help with your luggage - forget it. It's every man for himself at this Establishment. There are no porters and when I asked for help with my luggage when checking out I got a curt "We don't do that here" response from Reception. Let's move on to the air conditioning. The air conditioning is on a 4 hour timer for the discomfort of guests (note this is intentional). In the normal Meriton apartments that are for sale or lease all around Sydney i.e. not their serviced apartments, the air conditioning is normal and operational on demand by occupants. So it's obvious that the Meriton Serviced Apartments have deliberately put a 4 hour timer on the air conditioning in their Serviced Apartments to lower their electricity costs. Once again this is disgusting and an example of their appalling customer service and penny pinching. The airconditioning will therefore cut out during the night and when it's very hot in Sydney this could be a problem. The apartment guidebook says that the 4 hour cut off "can't be changed". They're lying - it can be changed for the whole block they just don't want to change it. So those are the negatives. Having said all of that would I stay at the Meriton Serviced Apartments in Bondi Junction again? Well surprisingly, the answer is yes. Why? Because if you want to stay in Bondi Junction there is no alternative that's why. I used to stay in Double Bay but both hotels have shut down. I do not want to stay in the Sydney CBD so unfortunately, it'll be the Meriton Bondi Junction when I'm in Sydney. However, next time I stay there my expectations will be drastically lowered and I'll know to expect apartments without the service. I would recommend these apartments to families and individuals who want to self cater and who don't want to stay in the Sydney CBD [but want to be a 12 minute train ride away] and want easy access to the Eastern Suburbs, great shopping within a minute's walk of the apartments and a 10 minute bus ride to Bondi Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled a great night”
Reviews.Author: Agent21
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment for a friends Birthday. For $500 i truly expected to have a clean room. On arrival the room had a smell but most frustrating was that none of the kitchen ware - despite the fact it was put away in the cupboards was clean and i had to wash it all before use. Isnt that the idea of a serviced apartment? That this is done on arrival? It wasnt and therefore had to spend 1 hour of my time washing up everything i needed. Not everything was terrible but some of the plates had substantial amounts of dirt and food remnants on them. I realise that past occupants may have washed these dishes but the onus is on the hotel and the housekeeping staff to check that they are at a satisfactory level before the next guests check in. The bath had a layer of dust and hair in it. The bathroom was cleaned very roughly. I am not a serial complainer, i felt compelled to complain due to the fact that 6 of us put in for the room for a friends birthday and the first part of it was spoilt because the housekeeping staff didnt do their job properly. Furthermore the clause in the compendium about leaving rubbish in the room and having to pay an extra $100 if the room is below your standards of clean. The room was certainly below my standards of clean. I frequently stay around Sydney and i would not recommend any Meriton properties to anyone nor will i choose to stay again. For $500 i feel i had to clean the room myself and i thought part of the absorbed cost of the room was the laundering and housekeeping service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, well-kept apartment”
Reviews.Author: slayme
Reviews.Content: We love the self-service aspect of staying in an apartment and therefore all we want is a place that is clean and nicely-equipped for cooking. The Meriton Bondi Junction excels on both counts. It was a relaxing and hassle-free stay. We had an abundance of clean towels and linens. The apartments are in a very convenient, and consequently, very busy location on top Bondi Junction station. However, the noise did not penetrate the apartment and it was relatively quiet. Overall, cosy and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, great price, good value overall”
Reviews.Author: SocaliOzfan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here about two weeks in early april. It was a great experience, and we'd go there again. The advantages were the low prices, mostly great staff, serviced rooms, the views of the harbour, being central to everything in Sydney, and having a clean and updated apartment with everything you could really need provided onsite; dishwasher, in apartment laundry, pool downstairs, and more. The downsides were small, but significant for light sleepers, like me: The timer shuts off after four hours on the air conditioner which woke me up for awhile, so that took some getting used to if you need the noise to sleep. They don't hide this fact, but I'd never thought to ask prior. In a way, I was glad they are saving the world with reducing energy, I just wish it wasn't at the expense of my ability to sleep! Also, we'd asked for King beds, and they had pushed two single beds together - which in my book, though not my partner's, was definitely not as comfortable. Overall, it was enjoyable, and a good value. One last caveat: Easter in Oz is a noisy, busy time, and more than one drunken, though friendly, reveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Bob1949
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks staying at the Meriton Bondi Tiffany apartments in Sydney. They are very good value for money and a one bedroom apartment on their long stay package, booked directly with Meriton, worked out at approximately Â£75 a night. The location of the apartments is excellent and you can get everywhere very easily whether it be the City (20 minutes) or Bondi Beach (10 minutes). We bought a pink travel pass available from most /all stations on a 7 day basis which cost approximately Â£25 and this allowed us travel on all buses, trains and ferries not just wthin the city but also to the suburbs as we wanted to go to a superb seafood restaurant on Cronulla Beach called Summer Salt - try it!! The ticket is not only good value but it was hugely convenient for just hopping on a bus, train or ferry without worrying about cash. The apartment is located just behind the entrance to the bus station and is on the road for the exit from Bondi Junction train station (50 metres). The lift to the apartment from street level takes you to a smart Reception and then a further lift takes you to your apartment. Security is excellent as your key card only allows you access to the floor your apartment is situated on. The one bedroom apartment we had was spacious, modern and clean. There were all the cooking utensils you need plus a very effective fridge, washing machine and tumble drier, microwave and cooker. The sitting area comprised a large sofabed and a dining table with four chairs. There vi loads of storage space throughout. The only frustration was that the enclosed balcony had a small table and two upright chairs which were uncomfortable. Two equally cheap chairs with arms would have made it better to sit on in the evening with a glass of wine but hey - that wasn't a major problem. The bedrom was fine with lots of hanging space but a limited number of coat hangers. Again, lots of storage space and a VERY comfortable bed. The lighting was fine. The TV in the sitting room had a range of channels and there is also a CD and DVD player. There seemed to be lots of younger students staying at the apartments but there was also a mix of older people and families. The apartment we had was silent from neighbours, the only noise was from the traffic below at this busy junction but the double glazing did its job. The air conditioning was fair but not hugely efficient. For those who are active there was a well equipped gym, sauna and swimmimg pool, facilties which were quiet for most of the day. There is recycling areas for glass and cardboard and located near each apartment is a shute for rubbish disposal. The staff at Reception were fine if not overly friendly but check in and check out were efficient so no complaints. Bondi Junction itself has a wide range of shops and cafes and ATM machines are located opposite the apartment and also in the Westfield Shopping Centre opposite where you have David Jones with a great Food Hall and supermarkets Woolworths and Coles plus bread shops, butchers, etc. etc. Internet access at the apartment is expensive but around the corner at a student travel shop, internet access is Â£1.50p an hour. The apartment was very easy to keep clean and tidy and was serviced once a week with clean bedding, towels etc. Otherwise, nobody bothers you and it is very easy living just outside the centre of the city. We did all the usual touristy things but highly recommended is a day trip to the Blue Mountains and we also enjoyed a Hunter Valley wine tour. Harry's Cafe de Wheels (a mobile upmarket takeaway) is a must for superb pie, mash and mushy peas with gravy and is based at Woolamaloo (apologies if the spelling is wrong!). This place seems like a Sydney institution and is well worth a visit - a short bus ride from Wynyard in the city centre using your pink card! Also well worth a visit is the Fish Market where you can buy a platter of superb seafood to eat whilst sitting on the grass or picnic benches and enjoy. It gets very busy at lunch hours so it is worth choosing your time. It cost approximately Â£15 for a platter of lobster, scallops, battered fish, prawns in cream sauce and a mound of chips!! Tremendous value and in honesty the freshest seafood I have ever tasted. I wolud say the food overall was the best I have experienced and knocks spots off London, even London's top restaurants. I thought Jersey food ( in the Channel Islands) was hard to beat but Sydney managed it at both expensive and cheaper levels. We ate lots of seafood, Thai, Malaysian, takeaway and expensive restaurant meals and didn't have one bad experience. Even the food to buy in the supermarkets to prepare at your apartment is fabulous and the service is exemplary - not the offhand approach often experienced in the UK! A good option for a drink is Orbit Bar which is a revolving bar overlooking the city. Drinks are reasonably priced and it is a better and cheaper option than going to the top of the Tower. All in all, we had a great stay and the apartment was well located for travel everywhere. We didnt travel back during the day however which would be possible if you were located in the centre of the city but that wasn't a problem for us. It could be done but would have taken an hour or so out of the day and it is as cheap to eat lunch in the centre overlooking the Opera House and Bridge. Would we stay again at the Meriton Bondi Apartments, most certainly. Was it total luxury, probably not compared to apartments costing twice as much which seemed to be the case in the city itself. For a two week stay it knocked spots off staying in a hotel with limited space and was tremendous value for money, allowed us to have a relaxed two week visit to Sydney and had all the convenience we wished for. Highly recommended!! In fact, we enjoyed our stay so much that from now on apartments will be my first priority for consideration over hotels when looking at booking long or short breaks. Well done Meriton!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rigseismic67
Reviews.Content: This was great with kids- we had a 2Br The railway station is under the building The pool is excellent Walk around the corner to Bondi Junction restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: KJTravelsWa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started and ended our Australian adventure at the Meriton Tiffany Bondi Juntion. The one-bedroom self catered apartment were perfect for us. The location is ideal. The rail and bus station are literally steps away connecting with everything in Sydney. Grocery and every type of shopping experience is a block away. The front desk staff (Adam and Frank in particular) were outstanding. When we return to Australia, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi Junk”
Reviews.Author: scottishsponger
Reviews.Content: The relatively low price for the location was what attracted us to this hotel initially, but once there we realised why it wasn't more expensive. Our request for a double bed had been ignored and in its place were two singles. They sent someone up to fix this pretty quickly but we were in a rush for a business appointment and had to get changed whilst the staff took an eternity to fix the bed, frequently disapearing from the room in the process. This wasn't a major worry, however once we went to bed, all we could hear over the din of people milling about on the streets below, was the fridge in the kitchen which was seemingly trying to take off into orbit judging by the sound it was making. It was so loud we could hear it at the other sidde of the apartment, through 2 closed doors. When I investigated further I found out the reason was that the fridge was probably purchased prior to the moon landings in 1969. I've not seen a fridge that old. The bathroom and kitchen generally required upgrading and the windows were obviously not up to blocking out any outside noise. Despite this we required a second night due to a change of plans and didn't want to pack up and move hotels, so we requested another night only to be told by reception that they couldn't book anything and we'd have to contact their reservations office! (what's the point of a hotel reception then, to hand out keys?!) When I called the reservation office(why do they do things this way) I was told there were no rooms available that night, only to find out after we checked out and went to look on the internet for another hotel that there were a number of rooms available here. To finnish off the experience for me, despite this hotel not being in the CBD they still have the cheek to sting you $20 to park your car there overnight. Not a good hotel experience, there are many better value places in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: J-Class_only
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights in November, Booking directly with Meriton through their website and waiting until just 14 days before arrival was able to get an excellent rate for a 1 bed apartment, Meriton automatically give you a discount if you book for 10 nights or more. On arrival we were given an upgrade to a 2-bed which was on a high floor with fabulous views of Sydney City Skyline, The Harbour Bridge and The Opera house. The apartment was large bright and very comfortable. Two large double rooms both en-suite. Fully functioning kitchen and large dining table enabled us to entertain a few nights and cooked here a lot. The apartments are right beside Westfield Bondi Junction a huge shopping centre with loads of shops including Woolworths and Coles for your groceries. Directly beneath the apatment block is Bondi Junction Bus/Train interchange itself, from here you can go basically anywhere in Sydney you want. We got a 7 day Bus/Train/Ferry Red travel pass for $38 (approx 19euro) in the newsagents in the station. It is fantastic value, the 333 bus takes you to Bondi beach in about 5-10 minutes and into the city in about 15-20mins. The only downside to these apartments are the dividing walls between apartments are very thin and you can hear alot going on next door. Our bedrooms were ajacent to next doors Living area so although they were just chatting and playing computer games we could hear everything, we are deep sleepers so no big deal for us but may be an issue for lighter sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good two bedroom apartment”
Reviews.Author: tev82
Reviews.Content: Very good serviced apartments; fully equiped, clean and decent location. Situated right above train & bus stations (although no noise (we were on 15th floor)). Staff were pleasant when approached. Gym was small but does the job. Indoor pool & jacuzzi didn't seem to get busy - again acceptable. Could see the Opera House & Bridge from the balconies - good location for the shops/pubs of Bondi Junction. About 4 miles North West to Circular Quay (Opera House etc). Roughly 15 mins on train, 20 mins on bus. Bondi Beach about 15 mins on bus towards the East. Cannot fault anything about the digs and location, but would probably stay more central (Darling Harbour possibly) next time.

Reviews.Title: “Transportation Central - Go everywhere easy!!”
Reviews.Author: amylmb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay in Sydney, normally an astronomically priced city, but here's the tip...get away from the CBD!! We paid 20% less just getting two subway stops away from the city. Meriton Bondi Junction is a highrise of two towers connected by a building housing a clean decent gym, nice quiet indoor pool and a green space on the roof, with tennis courts and picnic tables (no grill). Also under the building is an entrance to a small shopping mall. We stayed on the 8th floor of Tower I, Room #69 (the tower with the gym and pool downstairs). (The shopping entrance and a snooker table are located under Tower II). We arrived at 6:30AM and were told our room was ready for us...joy! Our view was towards Sydney's skyline and we enjoyed sitting on our enclosed balcony gazing at it. Pros: LOCATION is perfect to everything...train and bus transport is right under you, shopping, restaurants, The Bondi Junction Neighborhood Scene (lots of young hot people around), nice amenities, clean, the carpet and furniture are fresh and seemed new, washer/dryer in your room, excellent security, THE VIEWS!! Price, compared to CBD prices. Cons: Main complaint was the bathroom which was clean, but due to grotty grout seemed not so clean. Tiling could use a freshen. Also, there are drains in the floor of every bathroom, I'm told for ease of cleaning the floors, but they can sometimes smell a bit weird. Could use more mood lighting in the living room, expensive phone charges and the aircon is on a four-hour timer, which got a bit stuffy in the middle of the night after it cut off. Overall, small complaints that will not affect a great stay. Perhaps we were there at a low tourism season, but we had no problems with any noise at all, as other reviews have suggested.

Reviews.Title: “Served Us Well”
Reviews.Author: cdore01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meriton Bondi Junction for a week this October. Due to my brotherâ€™s disability, we needed a two bedroom/ two bath apartment - one that allowed us to support his needs as well as give him and my husband and I, privacy. We were told that the Meriton Bondi Junction had only a one bedroom/ one bath accessible apartment, but we thought we could make due with the two bed/two bathroom apartment after we saw the floor plan on the Meriton website. We truly missed grab rails in one of the bathrooms but had no other option since staying in a hotel would have put us in two separate rooms. This was not considered an accessible apartment, but it worked fine. We found the main room of the apartment spacious, and the entire apartment exceptionally clean. The beds were excellent. The kitchen was equipped with the supplies you needed for serving meals, which we did for most breakfasts and dinners. We were a bit southeast of the Sydney CBD, but with our car ($20 extra a day for parking in the garage), it worked well for in-Sydney exploring, as well as day trips beyond Sydney. . The Meriton Bondi Junction is an apartment complex that takes up a block. It is over a bus terminal and a garage, has a freeway in front of it, and a shopping mall beside it. Noise was never an issue and security is the most I have ever seen in this kind of facility- albeit a bit overwhelming when you first arrive (now where do I enter the building for check-in and which key makes the elevator move?). Having read on an earlier review that they had a wonderful view of Sydneyâ€™s skyline, I was a bit disappointed when we did not. Our apartment looked out over burned out lights of the shopping mall, the freeway, and Bondi beach, which is dark at night. This was my only disappointment. All else seemed great. They serviced our apartment once during the week, and even checked for anything broken or needing extra attention during the cleaning. We had access to their one computer in their business center for a fee, and the pool and sauna looked inviting. All in all, we would definitely stay here again as we liked the space, cleanliness, easy access to the city and the environs beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Sydney to stay”
Reviews.Author: derby66
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for accom in Sydney this is the place to stay. Exellent transport into the centre of Sydney . Catch a train round the corner only a few dollars to all the tourist attractions. Exellent self catering appartments, clean and very modern. Also indoor pool, sauna and spa pool ideal for families. Very helpful staff nothing too much trouble. Perfect for us wouldcertainly return

Reviews.Title: “Best for deaf people”
Reviews.Author: OskarandSunny
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice apartment with heaps of room . Great location and excellent views from higher up in the building Service was good but the noise thru the walls is terrible, in our room anyway. This is a new building and why they have not provided better sound proofing is most surprising. When we did complain after hearing every word on the neighbors TV and the game of football being played in the room above the hotel took immediate action. Just be warned if your a light sleeper expect to be woken

Reviews.Title: “Yet another excellent Meriton apartment”
Reviews.Author: wisend-traveller
Reviews.Content: I think my stay at the Meriton Bondi Junction completes my list of all the Meriton properties in NSW. I was pleasantly surprised by this place, as unlike the rest of the Meriton places, this is actually a refurbished hotel while all the rest are purpose built apartments. I wasn't expecting much, especially as I drove up to the property, situated right next to very busy (and noisey) expressway. I was pleased to be given a unit on the 18th floor (out of 20), and entered the room to the pleasing smell of a freshly decorated room, not too overpowering! I arrived just before sunset, and as I walked up to the windows, wa srewarded with perhaps THE most stunning view of Sydney Harbour, sweeping westwards towards the CBD, and the sun hanging in the background. The rooms and bathrooms were of the same standard you will find at any meriton apartment - modern style, good quality beds and linen, and always an enourmous bath. The kitchen was spotless, with virtually new SMEG appliances. The funny thing is this - and every Meriton apartment has the same - the cereal bowls are too shallow! How am I supposed to eat my weetbix out of those things??? Joking aside, out of all the meritons in Sydney, this is a very close second place behind the World Tower. FAcilities were good, gym was ok and pool excellent. The complex sits atop a very large shopping centre, so you are never far from all the action, lots of pubs and restaurants nearby too. All in all very very good. I will be back - especially as their rates are considerably lower than the CBD properties!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: rabthekebab
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week whilst travelling Oz on our honeymoon and the apartment was amazing! Excellent location with even better views of Sydney Harbour. Highly recommended....

Reviews.Title: “Clean with beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: dlester
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Meriton Tiffany Bondi Junction Apartment for 3 nights in January. I took a one bedroom apartment. It was clean, well organised with great views stretching across Sydney. There is also a gym, sauna and pool downstairs. This location is excellent for its proximity to transport options, shopping centres and is in a great Sydney location for touring. Reception are helpful yet a little distant but this didn't bother me. The only downside is the smell outside the entrance of the building. Otherwise, it was really excellent value for money considering the prices of accommodation in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied with the Meriton”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee375
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2BR apartment in the Meriton for a 7 day stay, The layout and space in the apartment is great - you are provided with all of the amenties you need for a longer stay and the location is fantastic. I would highly recommend this place. While it doesnt have the ambience or energy of a swanky hotel, it provides you will all of the amenities and room to create a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment and location.”
Reviews.Author: Sussex_2
Reviews.Content: We'd checked out these apartments on trip adviser before we left as we've never been to Oz before. We stayed at the apartments just 3 weeks ago (Dec 07) and the apartment we had was fantastic. Clean, spacious (we'd booked the 2 bedroom), well equipped with modern furniture - that felt more like a showhome than hotel. Our balcony had views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge and the option of 3 balconys (one from each bedroom and the sitting room) meant we could use the covered balcony when the weather wasn't so good ... yes it rained on us when we first arrived! If you are going to cook in the apartment watch the smoke alarm as it is incredibly sensitive to the slightest burnt cooking! The pool and gym were great (plenty of equipment in the gym) and the reception staff friendly and helpful. We didn't use the tennis courts or games area. Travel to Circle Harbour was 10 minutes by train from the station underneath the apartments, Bondi Beach 10 minutes by bus - again from under the apartment. The shopping centre opposite the apartments was great and included Coles & Woolworths supermarkets so easy to stock up. Plenty of restaurants round the hotel too - a couple could be used for 'room service' but we didnt' use these. All in all would wholly recommend - only wished we'd booked to stay there on our returning visit to Sydney rather than the accomodation in Darling Harbour which we won't be giving as favourable review too!

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodation”
Reviews.Author: TheCommittee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from great Sydney holiday. We stayed first three nights at Meriton in Pitt St, then moved to the Bondi property for the final night. We booked a two bedroom, but were given a three bedroom. The apartment was spacious and the views amazing. Position is perfect, just across the road from the huge Bondi Junction shopping mall complete with David Jones food hall and supermarket for all supplies. I would definitely stay here again - even in preference to staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Vickyqin
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay!!!The one bedroom apartment we had was on the top floor, it's spacious and clean. Both lounge room and bedroom have balconies with amazing views. The reception staff was quite nice and helpful, and we quite enjoy the pool and the spa! We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved these apartments”
Reviews.Author: Kabwe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a three bedroom apartment Level 15 corner of the building. Amazing 250 degree views of the city with spectacular views of the sun rise and sunsets. Location is good, handy for public transport to the beach and the city, close to the top of funky Oxford St, easy access to Centennial Park for a jog and right next to a huge shopping centre. The entrance was hard to find and just off the transit centre in Bondi Junction and like any other transit centre it has its set of weirdoes getting on and off buses. Donâ€™t be put off by the entrance which seems low key the apartments are great, big bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and kitchen area separate from the living and dinning area two balconies good quality fitting. Being high up we got the breeze and not the pollution. My only gripes were a great kitchen but not so much as a coffee sachet or tea bag on hand, I couldn't work out how to get the email up and the Gym was very ordinary. The other guests there seemed to be a huge posse of American Exchange Students with their perfect teeth always in the lift and the pool and a lot of longer staying business people. Good for families, business people and long stays in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Rob1233
Reviews.Content: The Meriton was OK - we stayed for two weeks and the things we loved were: - the view! - pretty high quality fixtures in the kitchen and bathroom; - didn't hear the neighbours etc. - the shopping centre next door. but we really didn't like: - the staff weren't that competent, and the hotel had some strange policies about paying in advance which were enforced quite aggressively leaving you feeling a bit like a criminal! - the fact that you have to take 2 lifts (and wait a long time) to get in and out was annoying; - the swimming pools seemed OK, but were out of service for much of our stay; - the rooms are getting a bit old now; Overall it certainly isn't a five star place, but if you get a cheap deal then you could do worse...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: EdwardsinHK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one week in Dec 3 - 9, 2006. We had a one bedroom apt on the 12th floor and it was great. Modern furnishings, clean and no compliants whatsoever. This is a great location since it's above the train station and bus terminus. You can get to the city and the beach in no time. There is a shopping mall (Westfield) directly across the street with a Coles supermarket that opens till midnight. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: ageingwanderers
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a holiday apartment with comfortable modern style and furnishings this place is just great. We wanted to be within easy reach of Bondi beach and Sydney city centre - this was perfect - ten mins to Bondi beach by bus (ran every ten mins) and right above the station for trains to centre of Sydney - about twenty minutes. We wondered about the location as we remembered Bondi Junction as an uninspiring sort of place, but were delighted with the views of Sydney harbour from our spacious, light apartment. All mod cons, and an unexpected surprise when we discovered the Westfield shopping centre right next door - five floors of shops including the wonderful David Jones food hall where you could buy gourmet goodies for eating in with very little cooking involved. We loved this location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good except for the air conditioning noise”
Reviews.Author: Macdaddyn
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay at these apartments. The position is excellent if you don't need or want to be in the CBD. These apartments are built above the Bondi Junction railway station & bus terminus so it is very easy to get around Sydney by public transport if you wish. The one bedroom apartment we had was quite large, well appointed & comfortable. Our one gripe was the noise the air conditioning made when on. As it is winter here, we were trying to heat the apartment. There was only one fan setting (high) & it made so much noise that it was hard to even hear the television. We took to running the air conditioning only when we were away from the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “loved it here”
Reviews.Author: philjaye
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay here and thought it was fabulous and have allready booked to return.Could not complain about anything.We had a recently refurbished 3 bedroom apartment wich was lovely with fantastic views.Great pool , spa and gym.Also great tennis courts.My 8 year old had a ball.Shops just accross the road.I would definately recommend

Reviews.Title: “Meriton Tiffany should be renamed Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Fiona610
Reviews.Content: First up, I'd like to say that these apartments are in an excellent location and some have magnificent views. The apartments are modern and well appointed, however, my gripe lies with the Reservations staff/system and the reception staff. My husband booked two apartments 11 days prior to our stay - 1x3 bedroom and 1x2 bedroom as there were 10 of us travelling and had relatives with us from the UK. Our booking was taken and we were assured that our requirements for accommodation were able to be met. My husband was told that there was plenty of accommodation available at the Tiffany. The only thing they couldn't guarantee was that the apartments would be on the same floor. No problem. Five days prior to our arrival, my husband rang to confirm the accommodation. No problem. We arrived in Sydney at lunchtime and decided to call to see if the apartments were ready. They weren't, but I was told we could check in at 2pm. A few minutes later, I get a call from the Reservations staff to say that there was a 'problem' with our booking. They couldn't give us the accommodation we had booked and paid for 11 days ago, due to some mix up with the booking system. After plenty of stuffing around, we ended up with 2x2 bedroom apartments and a 1x1 bedroom apartment all on different floors. When we got to ours we were greeted with a gas bottle on a trolley, oxy welding equipment, power tools and the air conditioning compressor lying in the middle of the floor. Back down to reception. After about 15 minutes we were finally given another apartment on the 18th floor. This meant we had elderly parents on the 11th, relatives on the 10th and us on the 18th. We soon discovered that our key cards wouldn't work between those floors. Back to reception. When we got there, there was a woman in tears. She had been trapped in one of the lifts for over an hour and was quite distressed. Meriton Management, you need to lift your game. This sort of stuff shouldn't happen and you shouldn't be taking bookings for accommodation you can't provide. We have stayed here before and had no problem and found the apartments to be of a high standard. They are furnished comfortably and are cleaned very well. This time was just so disappointing that my confidence in their reservations system and staff will probably deter us from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Good Room”
Reviews.Author: patrick-syd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in late Feb-Mar 2005. I didnt know there was this serviced apartment before but I always like Bondi Junction since I was a student in Sydney. Since we will be in Sydney for more than a week so I decided to stay somewhere where we can cook sometimes and can do the laundry. So I searched for a good serviced apartment and we ended up here instead of those in the CBD. We need only a room for 2 but the first night we arrived, there was no one bedroom apartment available so we booked a 2-bedroom with Sydney Harbour view. This room was huge, complete with everything you need in your apartment. There were 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, lounge+dining area next to the kitchen, laundry+dryer. There was enclosed balcony as well. Oh there were CD player & DVD player in the living area too. The aircon was weird though, it kept shut down from time to time! But overall it was really good value and excellent view of the Harbour and Bellevue Hill. Then the next 7 nights, we moved to the other room we booked, it was a Sub-penthouse One-Bedroom apartment with Eastern Suburb & Botany Bay View. The rate was the same as other One-bedroom apartment though. The name Sub-Penthouse was from being on the floor underneath the Penthouse. Nothing so special like it sound. This room was smaller than the previous one we stayed but it was still good. It had everything you need though there were no CD player nor DVD player in this type of apartment. They should have corrected what they have advertised about this though. The bedroom was good with a little balcony that we could see the Centenial Park & Aussie Stadium, very nice view. The bed was comfy that I woke up late everyday :o) There was another enclosed balcony at the living area too. We cooked breakfast every morning in our kitchen and that felt like being at home for us. One Sunday night, we even invited a few local friends for a dinner party in our apartment. That was lovely too. The location was fantastic for those who dont like to stay in the CBD. Bondi Junction CityRail station is under the building so it only takes 5mins to Kings Cross and around 10mins by train to Martin Place, Town Hall and Central stations. Beside the bus stops are on the ground level of the train station so you could catch the buses to Bondi, Bronte, Coogee beaches including Watsons Bay, Double Bay, Rose Bay. You can take the buses to Paddington(Market on every Sat), Oxford Street(Darlinghurst), and CBD as well. Next to the Meriton Tiffany, there were a few shopping centres such as Westfield Bondi Junction and East Gate(cant remember the name) with a few huge supermarkets inside (Coles, Woolworths etc). You can buy anything from there. The Oxford St Mall, with lots of shops and cafes, is also on the ground level just few steps from the apartment so it is really convenient to buy stuff. I really enjoyed being in this area! But only recommend to those who likes to stay away from the CBD but not too far and still convenient :o)
